question: Which satellite was launched by NASA for ensuring that astronauts at the International Space Station can communicate with Earth?
explanation: NASA has launched TDRS-M satellite on 18th of August 2017. It aimed at ensuring astronauts at the International Space Station can communicate with Earth. The satellite will support critical space communication into the mid-2020s. The $408 million Boeing-made Tracking and Data Relay Satellite (TDRS-M) rose into space atop an Atlas V rocket that launched from Cape Canaveral, Florida.
